title: 114_s3226
content: The Act titled "Enewetak Atoll Cleanup Veterans Registry and Study Act of 2016" establishes the Enewetak Atoll Cleanup Registry. The "Enewetak Atoll Veterans Health Registry" is established by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for individuals who performed a radiation cleanup mission in the Enewetak Atoll between 1977 and 1980 and apply for care from the Department of Veterans Affairs. The Enewetak Atoll Veterans Health Registry is established for individuals who performed a radiation cleanup mission between 1977 and 1980 and meet certain criteria such as filing a claim for compensation, requesting a health examination, or submitting relevant medical data. The Enewetak Atoll Veterans Health Registry includes relevant medical data for individuals who grant permission or are deceased. The Secretary will include information for individuals who submitted claims before the enactment date. The Secretary provides health examinations, diagnostic tests, and counseling to individuals upon request. For deceased individuals, consultation and counseling are also available to their spouse, child, or parent. The Secretary conducts outreach to individuals listed in the registry regarding research on health consequences of radiation exposure at Enewetak Atoll. The Secretary of Defense provides information to the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will conduct an independent study on potential radiation exposure at Enewetak Atoll from 1977 to 1980, to be completed within one year by a non-affiliated entity with experience in radiation studies. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will submit an annual report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the Registry, including the number of veterans included, trends in compensation claims, and outreach efforts. The Secretary will report on outreach efforts made under subsection (e) and any other relevant matters in the annual report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs.
